definition[0]: to reduce the value of one country’s money when it is exchanged for another country’s money
example[0]: Nigeria has just devalued its currency.
definition[1]: to make someone or something seem less important or valuable
example[1]: History has tended to devalue the contributions of women.
definition[2]: to cause something to lose its value
example[2]: Heavy price discounting will devalue our famous brands.
definition[3]: when a country devalues its currency against other currencies, it decreases its value for economic reasons, for example to make its exports cheaper
example[3]: Hungary said it will devalue its currency by an average of 15% against major Western currencies.
definition[4]: when a country’s currency devalues against others, it loses its value
example[4]: With more money coming into circulation, the ruble may devalue further.
